name: Everything Under Your Hat Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the largest-toothed animal on the earth today?
questions.explanation:
Sperm Whale.

	An individual tooth may weigh over 2 pounds, reaching a length of 8 inches and a diameter of 4 inches.

questions.text: The Rolling Stones rephrased the words of their hit song 'Let's Spend the Night Together' on The Ed Sullivan Show in 1967. Which word did they change?
questions.explanation:
Night.

	The American public was not yet ready to hear such racy music piped into their livingrooms.

questions.text: What European city was home to the world's first stock exchange?
questions.explanation:
Antwerp.

	Antwerp, Belgium, in 1531. At the time, the Belgium port city was the busiest commercial and financial center in the world.

questions.text: In Japan, eggs provide the coloring for yellow noodles, and cuttlefish provide the coloring for black noodles. What's used for red noodles?
questions.explanation:
Apricots.

	Yams provide the color for brown noodles, green tea for green noodles.

questions.text: What actor-director's father was a member of the 1960's folk group the Highwaymen?
questions.explanation:
Tim Robbins.

	His father, Gil Robbins went on to manage the Gaslight, a famous folk-music club in New York City's Greenwich Village.

questions.text: Which is not in a shoofly pie?
questions.explanation:
Salt.

	The super-sweet Pennsylvania Dutch dessert pie supposedly was named for all the flies it drew away from other food.

questions.text: Which sport gave us the term 'to win hands down'?
questions.explanation:
Horse Racing.

	The phrase originally meant to win a race by such a large margin, the jockey didn't have to flick his reins or whip the horse-thus winning with his hands down.

questions.text: England's Prince William wears an insignia on his clothes. It says WOW. What does the first W stand for?
questions.explanation:
William.

	It is an acronym for his title William of Wales.

questions.text: For what profession was Josef Stalin studying before he became a Marxist?
questions.explanation:
The priesthood.

	Stalin's family name was Dzhugashvili. As a revolutionary, he adopted the name Stalin - Russian for 'made of steel'.

questions.text: How many sides are there to a dodecagon?
